column5: congrats on the pb

Ok...my brother-in-law is in town from the States and we've been taking him to our secret Walleye spot a few times over the past week.  Blyght and I did our best to show him our technique and he was doing great!  He hasn't caught anything as of yet.  Well, tonite we went out and about a half hour into it, I hooked what I thought was a pretty big Walleye!  As I was reeling him in, it surprised me by instantly running and taking lots of drag.  As he got closer he jumped out of the water a few times.  I knew then it wasn't a Walleye...they normally fight for a minute or so and then come in like logs.  Anyhow, this is what I pulled out of Lake Ontario....  My first ever Northern Pike...measured in at 34", 15.5" girth and weighed 10 pounds, 4 ounces.    We bought a new rapala digital scale today, so we just HAD to test out right?  haha.  He was hooked pretty deep and I was afraid he wouldn't make it, but after using my new hip waders, I took him out about 6 feet and he took off splashing water on me.  That's it for now...what a rush...my first ever pike.....what a day!!!

Ain't that sweet...he gives me credit for being a fast learner but what he doesn't tell you is that he is lying...I still don't trust that they took me to the secret walleye spot.  Everytime this week we have gone out, I have been drugged and blind folded, they made me carry all the gear, stand in Lake Ontario for 30 minutes and then they still gave me a lure without hooks.  I have to use it until they land first fish.  I was all excited about his pike, they gave me a real lure, aftet my first cast, ccmt said it was time to go!  Alex (the brother-in-law)  PS.  He is letting me come steelheading with him Friday but only after I buy and prepare all the roe bags on Thursday while he is out fishing.......  PPS  New to the board, proper intro coming soon
ccmtcanada, you ROCK!  You and your wifes reports never cease to amaze me, nice going.
Way to go ccmt awesome looking pike and great report.

Way to go again man.For a guy who has not fished for 20 years you are certainly doing well.Nice pike my PB was caught this year only 8lbs.You 're either reall lucky or Fishin Devil   and Blyght are great teachers.Who stuffed the horshoe up......................You are a lucky man. Mike
Great report, and congrrats on your first ever pike, must of been a scrappy fight
Sweet gator! You da man........................... again!   Thanks for the post.
Congrats on the p.b.Keep the reports coming.It makes my days at work more interesting.Did I say work I meant home.Dan
Congrats on the PB...it's a great looking fish!  Welcome to the OFC Alex!!  dk
Congrats Cliff on the PB pike, very nice looking one too.  Thanks for the report, nice to see them this late in the year too.  Alex, welcome to the board.
Beauty Pike, great report as always... you don't make Alex ride in the trunk do ya ???  Yes welcome Alex...
Thank you every one for the welcomes , and no they don't make me ride in the trunk . They do make me watch the kids while they "run errands" aleast thats what they tell me
Very, Very nice.  Absolutely wicked.  Landing a chunkster like that with no leader is no easy task.  Congrats on your new personal best, it's a biggie.  Welcome aboard Alex,
You've had an amazing season, with the PB walleyes and now a great first pike, congrats!  Mike
nice!!
Dude!  Thats awesome!!!!!!  This little honey hole you have is the new garden of eden or Atlantis!  Way to go Cliff.

congrats,cliff   great report and 1 very nice sized pike,that spot of yours is really producing well for you,and im glad you and your broyher in-law are still getting to fish ,with the weather being great,take care and chat soon

wooohooo Right on CCMT - what a catch....Not to shabby at all for a first pike!  What ever happened to your "last post of the season"? that was like what, 4 trophy eyes and a gator ago? haha  Thanks for the report!  UF
thats a nice pike
And here I am, sitting on my arse, lamenting that the season is over.  Kudos to your determination, ccmt, and for showing us once again why patience and resolve are virtues to be had.
nice one! congrats!
The temps are co-operating. I'm sure you'll do whatever it takes to beat your pb walleye. Reports are awesome.  Congrats on the pike. Keep 'em coming.

Thanks everyone!!!  I'm just amazed that we are still able to shore fish this late in December.  That pike was sure different than hooking into a big walleye....an even more awesome feeling to actually land the thing.  I'll be fishing all winter long if the temps stay like this....
Kudos CC,
